channel.title: Gavin Turk on Artangled
channel.description: Recent content in Gavin Turk on Artangled

item.title: Richard Patterson: Only Fans | Timothy Taylor
item.description: Richard Patterson was a YBA, part of the scandalous 1990s ‘Sensation’ generation. But, like his peers Gillian Wearing and Gavin Turk, he’s matured into a painter of sensitivity and skill. Proof of this view comes in ‘Only Fans’, a show of small-format works using what the press release describes as a “carnal palette”, which closed this week at Timothy Taylor. All 13 paintings in the exhibition are dreamy swirls of flesh-toned roses and ochres, on luxurious-looking linen canvas.

item.title: Gavin Turk - White Van Man | Paul Stolper
item.description: I saw this exhibition, subtitled ‘A Brexit portfolio and other Transit Disasters’ at a time when the thoroughly depressing Brexit negotiations were reaching something of a climax. The central motif of the various silkscreen prints is a burnt out Ford Transit. Any British observer would recognise the cultural signifier of a white van - home to “White Van Man”, a highly Brexity demographic. The prints themselves owe an obvious debt to Warhol’s gloomy 60s prints of car crashes.
